verses.text_plain: Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise;
verses.verse_html: 1Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise;

verses.text_plain: For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue.
verses.verse_html:
2For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue. ▼
▼ of the deceitful: Heb. of deceit
 , ▼
▼ are opened: Heb. have opened themselves

footnotes.body_text: ▼ of the deceitful: Heb. of deceit
footnotes.body_html: ▼ of the deceitful: Heb. of deceit

footnotes.body_text: ▼ are opened: Heb. have opened themselves
footnotes.body_html: ▼ are opened: Heb. have opened themselves

verses.text_plain: They compassed me about also with words of hatred; and fought against me without a cause.
verses.verse_html: 3They compassed me about also with words of hatred; and fought against me without a cause.

verses.text_plain: For my love they are my adversaries: but I give myself unto prayer.
verses.verse_html: 4For my love they are my adversaries: but I give myself unto prayer.

verses.text_plain: And they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.
verses.verse_html: 5And they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.

verses.text_plain: Set thou a wicked man over him: and let Satan stand at his right hand.
verses.verse_html:
6Set thou a wicked man over him: and let Satan stand at his right hand. ▼
▼ Satan: or, an adversary

footnotes.body_html: ▼ Satan: or, an adversary

verses.text_plain: When he shall be judged, let him be condemned: and let his prayer become sin.
verses.verse_html:
7When he shall be judged, let him be condemned: and let his prayer become sin. ▼
▼ be condemned: Heb. go out guilty, or, wicked

footnotes.body_text: ▼ be condemned: Heb. go out guilty, or, wicked
footnotes.body_html: ▼ be condemned: Heb. go out guilty, or, wicked

verses.text_plain: Let his days be few; and let another take his office.
verses.verse_html:
8Let his days be few; and let another take his office. ▼
▼ office: or, charge

verses.text_plain: Let his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.
verses.verse_html: 9Let his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.

verses.text_plain: Let his children be continually vagabonds, and beg: let them seek their bread also out of their desolate places.
verses.verse_html: 10Let his children be continually vagabonds, and beg: let them seek their bread also out of their desolate places.

tokens.text: also out of their desolate places

verses.text_plain: Let the extortioner catch all that he hath; and let the strangers spoil his labour.
verses.verse_html: 11Let the extortioner catch all that he hath; and let the strangers spoil his labour.

tokens.text: all that he hath; and let the strangers

verses.text_plain: Let there be none to extend mercy unto him: neither let there be any to favour his fatherless children.
verses.verse_html: 12Let there be none to extend mercy unto him: neither let there be any to favour his fatherless children.

tokens.text: Let there be none to extend
unto him: neither let there be any to favour

verses.text_plain: Let his posterity be cut off; and in the generation following let their name be blotted out.
verses.verse_html: 13Let his posterity be cut off; and in the generation following let their name be blotted out.

verses.text_plain: Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the Lord; and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.
verses.verse_html: 14Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the Lord; and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.

verses.text_plain: Let them be before the Lord continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth.
verses.verse_html: 15Let them be before the Lord continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth.

tokens.text: Let them be before the Lord

verses.text_plain: Because that he remembered not to shew mercy, but persecuted the poor and needy man, that he might even slay the broken in heart.
verses.verse_html: 16Because that he remembered not to shew mercy, but persecuted the poor and needy man, that he might even slay the broken in heart.

verses.text_plain: As he loved cursing, so let it come unto him: as he delighted not in blessing, so let it be far from him.
verses.verse_html: 17As he loved cursing, so let it come unto him: as he delighted not in blessing, so let it be far from him.

verses.text_plain: As he clothed himself with cursing like as with his garment, so let it come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones.
verses.verse_html:
18As he clothed himself with cursing like as with his garment, so let it come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones. ▼
▼ into his bowels: Heb. within him

footnotes.body_text: ▼ into his bowels: Heb. within him
footnotes.body_html: ▼ into his bowels: Heb. within him

verses.text_plain: Let it be unto him as the garment which covereth him, and for a girdle wherewith he is girded continually.
verses.verse_html: 19Let it be unto him as the garment which covereth him, and for a girdle wherewith he is girded continually.

tokens.text: Let it be unto him as the garment

verses.text_plain: Let this be the reward of mine adversaries from the Lord, and of them that speak evil against my soul.
verses.verse_html: 20Let this be the reward of mine adversaries from the Lord, and of them that speak evil against my soul.

verses.text_plain: But do thou for me, O God the Lord, for thy name’s sake: because thy mercy is good, deliver thou me.
verses.verse_html: 21But do thou for me, O God the Lord, for thy name’s sake: because thy mercy is good, deliver thou me.

verses.text_plain: For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.
verses.verse_html: 22For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.

verses.text_plain: I am gone like the shadow when it declineth: I am tossed up and down as the locust.
verses.verse_html: 23I am gone like the shadow when it declineth: I am tossed up and down as the locust.

tokens.text: I am tossed up and down

verses.text_plain: My knees are weak through fasting; and my flesh faileth of fatness.
verses.verse_html: 24My knees are weak through fasting; and my flesh faileth of fatness.

verses.text_plain: I became also a reproach unto them: when they looked upon me they shaked their heads.
verses.verse_html: 25I became also a reproach unto them: when they looked upon me they shaked their heads.

verses.text_plain: Help me, O Lord my God: O save me according to thy mercy:
verses.verse_html: 26Help me, O Lord my God: O save me according to thy mercy:

verses.text_plain: That they may know that this is thy hand; that thou, Lord, hast done it.
verses.verse_html: 27That they may know that this is thy hand; that thou, Lord, hast done it.

verses.text_plain: Let them curse, but bless thou: when they arise, let them be ashamed; but let thy servant rejoice.
verses.verse_html: 28Let them curse, but bless thou: when they arise, let them be ashamed; but let thy servant rejoice.

verses.text_plain: Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with their own confusion, as with a mantle.
verses.verse_html: 29Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with their own confusion, as with a mantle.

verses.text_plain: I will greatly praise the Lord with my mouth; yea, I will praise him among the multitude.
verses.verse_html: 30I will greatly praise the Lord with my mouth; yea, I will praise him among the multitude.

verses.text_plain: For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor, to save him from those that condemn his soul.
verses.verse_html:
31For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor, to save him from those that condemn his soul. ▼
▼ those…: Heb. the judges of

footnotes.body_html: ▼ those…: Heb. the judges of
